Class DayPlanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • cis2430_dayplanner.DayPlanner

  • public class DayPlanner
extends java.lang.Object
    Main Class which runs the program.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DayPlanner

        public DayPlanner()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main function which operates the control loop for the DayPlanner program, allowing the use to add new activities, and search for existing activies. This function creates the arrays to hold the different activities as well as iterators to keep track of the elements in the array.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments

      • menu

        public static char menu()
        Displays a menu with options: Add Search Quit and returns a character representing the user's selected choice. 'a' for Add 's' for Search 'q' for Quit
        Returns:
        character representing the user's choice

      • newHomeActivity

        public static HomeActivity newHomeActivity()
        Gets the input required to construct a HomeActivity class, creates the class, and returns it to the user
        Returns:
        a new HomeActivity class

      • newSchoolActivity

        public static SchoolActivity newSchoolActivity()
        Gets the input required to construct a SchoolActivity class, creates the class, and returns it to the user
        Returns:
        a new SchoolActivity class

      • newOtherActivity

        public static OtherActivity newOtherActivity()
        Gets the input required to construct a OtherActivity class, creates the class, and returns it to the user
        Returns:
        a new OtherActivity class

      • newTime

        public static Time newTime()
        Gets input from the user required to create a new Time class, then constructs the class and returns it to the user. All input is check to ensure it is within a valid range for the respective variable. For example month must be within 1-12.
        Returns:
        a new Time class

      • getActivityType

        public static char getActivityType(boolean empty)
        Gets the user to select an activity type, and returns it as a character of the first letter of the activity type. If empty is true this function will also accept empty input. For example: 'h' for home 's' for school 'o' for other 'newline' for empty
        Parameters:
        empty - whether or not the function is allowed to accept empty input
        Returns:
        character representing the user's choice
